metadata.title: CVE-2020-28049 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - low.
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in SDDM before 0.19.0. It incorrectly starts the X server in a way that - for a short time period - allows local unprivileged users to create a connection to the X server without providing proper authentication. A local attacker can thus access X server display contents and, for example, intercept keystrokes or access the clipboard. This is caused by a race condition during Xauthority file creation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28049` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sddm - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-debian-elarun - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-debian-maui - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-elarun - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-maldives - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-maui - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
sddm-theme-maya - 0.19.0-2ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sddm package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.19.0-2ubuntu1').
